intro: Archibaccharis campii, commonly known as the Brazilian heather, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses for its aesthetic appeal.
